alert.note: Alert for Henderson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 26 at 6:52PM EST until December 28 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following county, Henderson. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 647 PM EST, Automated rain gauges indicate that 4 to 5 inches of rain affected this area over the past 24 hours. Flooding is ongoing in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hendersonville, Flat Rock, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Valley Hill, East Flat Rock, Dana and Crab Creek. - Flooding continues along Mud Creek, likely impacting William King Memorial Park and South Center Plaza in Hendersonville, and also along Bat Fork Creek, where Dana Road and Tracy Grove Roads are likely flooded. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
